In addition to the International Mechanical Code, the facility has based its maintenance program on the industry standard: The International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) guidelines.  In particular, ANSI/IIAR Standard 6-2019, Inspection, Testing, and Maintenance of Closed-Circuit Ammonia Refrigeration Systems is used at the facility.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

An investigation into Richmond Beverage Solutions, LLC. accident history showed that there had been no reportable accidents with ammonia in the last 5 years. In addition, there have been no injuries resulting from an ammonia incident.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Richmond Beverage Solutions, LLC. has an emergency action plan in effect at the facility.  The Emergency Response Plan is detailed in the Emergency Action section of the PSM document, which is maintained at the facility. This plan was designed to meet the following objectives:

  1.)  To save lives.
  2.)  To minimize and avoid injuries.
  3.)  To protect the environment.
  4.)  To minimize property damage.

Richmond Beverage Solutions, LLC. maintains a PSM/RMP team whose members are the designated emergency coordinators for the facility.  The plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards, and mitigation procedures which will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise at the facility.  This plan is reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with the PSM and RMP regulations, as well as to incorporate facility changes due to the renovation of the facility.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

Richmond Beverage Solutions, LLC. is located in Richmond, Indiana and provides refrigeration for dairy products.  Richmond Beverage Solutions, LLC. senior management is not only committed to offer superior service, but also maintain a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities.  The Richmond Beverage Solutions, LLC. administers safety and environmental policies at the facility to ensure compliance with OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) and EPA's Risk Management Program (RMP).  These programs include forklift safety, hazard communications, lockout/tagout, employee safety manuals, manufacturer's documentation, and the Emergency Response Plan. Portions of our programs have been extended to include a non-covered process.

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE

Richmond Beverage Solutions, LLC. is located at 1590 N.W. 11th Street in Richmond, Indiana.  The facilities ammonia refrigeration system was designed and constructed in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations.

The system uses approximately 17,000 pounds of ammonia to provide refrigeration for dairy products.  The majority of the system including vessels and compressors, is located outside of the facility building in a contained engine room.  The condensers are mounted on the roof, or the engine room and all of the evaporators are located in their respective cold storage areas.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

At Richmond Beverage Solutions, LLC., the ammonia refrigeration system has many safety features.  Much of the safety of the system is inherent in the policies and procedures that govern the operation of the system. For example, Richmond Beverage Solutions, LLC. operates in accordance with OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation.
